note: Poverty data is measured in [international-$](#dod:int_dollar_abbreviation) at 2017 prices to account for inflation and differences in the cost of living between countries. Depending on the country and year, it relates to income measured after taxes and benefits, or to consumption, [per capita](#dod:per-capita).
title: Death rate from indoor air pollution vs. share in extreme poverty
subtitle: Age-standardized death rates from illness attributed to household air pollution from solid cooking fuels, measured per 100,000 individuals versus the share of the total population living below the International Poverty Line of $2.15 per day.
